newsitem.title: USA: Gibson Greetings settles litigation. [CORRECTED 09:55 GMT 21/12]
newsitem.headline: Gibson Greetings settles litigation. [CORRECTED 09:55 GMT 21/12]

text.p: Gibson Greetings Inc said Friday that it settled the securities class action lawsuit filed April 10, 1995, in an Ohio court.
Plaintiffs alleged that the company failed to disclose allegedly material information regarding its financial performance in 1994.

The financial terms involve the creation of a fund of $1.6 million, of which the company is responsible for less than $600,000, to be distributed to shareholders who purchased Gibson stock between August 17, 1994, and February 9, 1995 (corrects years from 1993 and 1994, respectively), who file proofs of claim. United States District Judge Herman Weber preliminarily approved the settlement on December 5, 1996, and set a hearing on final approval for February 7, 1997.

In a statement on the settlement, Gibson President and Chief Executive Frank O'Connell said, "We are delighted to conclude this litigation. By reaching this settlement, we are eliminating the substantial costs that any company incurs in defending a class action lawsuit. The settlement also limits distractions of the past and permits us to focus our energy and attention on continuing to build shareholder value into the future."
